title: Thunderbird stopped sending emails for all of my accounts... nothing changed. Just suddenly stopped
content:
I went to send an email this afternoon and I kept getting this error Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing server (SMTP) myserver.com was lost in the middle of the transaction. Try again.

Nothing has changed in my SMTP settings, nothing has changed on my computer, nothing has changed with my service provider.

I have verified all of my SMTP settings and my passwords.

I am able to send emails from cpanel (Roundcube) just not Thunderbird

Thunderbird version 102.10.1 OSX 10.15.7 Mail provider: GoDaddy/Cpanel
creator: jaycbrf

title: Thunderbird 102.10.1
content: Since the auto upgrade to 102.10.1 the smtp server has done the following Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail: Outgoing server (SMTP) error. The server responded: +OK InterMail POP3 server ready..

title: Cannot send e-mail messages in Thunderbird
content: Keep receiving a pop-up messages, saying that my PDQ (My old ISP, now is Rise Broadband) settings are out of date. Contacted my ISP and rec'd help to reconfigure. Now, I am unable to send messages from my Inbox (Thunderbird). Rise Broadband has given up and tells me to contact Thunderbird. I am an elder user and 'reading' anything technical is beyond my capacity. Can anyone help me?
creator: marybess

title: Thunderbird recovered emails
content:
I had a computer hd crash that had a POP3 email account. I was able to recover the profile with the emails. I just can't get them to 'sync' to a new install of Thunderbird. I have the account and then copied the profile and pasted it into the new directory. It said it is updating but none of the emails and folders are there??

I tried the built in recovery tool, but that is not working either.

Any suggestions?

Thanks
creator: jswiatek

title: Thunderbird : bug in default smtp instead of choosen smtp
content:
hello

it happened twice : the first time few years ago, when sending a mail from a attt a doooot com, with others b attt b doooot com and c attt c doooot com in parallel every emails, even with another address choosen, were sent with c attt c doooot com, without respecting the latest compositing windows email account selection

the only solution was to reset the profile.

today, I get almost the same : I have several different address within my thunderbird. eg 5 email addresses from 2 different ISP however, when writing an email, defaut is a attt a doooot com ; I then choose to send it with b attt b doooot com ; however a attt a doooot com is in the default general smtp parameters, the default one. But. when I write a mail, I consider, in the top of the window, the email account to send it coud be b attt b doooot com, where after a certain period of time (few weeks or months) with that profile, ALL mails are sent with the “general smtp default profile”, instead of the one I choose with the compositing window. that meanss, in others words, that if I write a new mail, by default thund proposes me to send it with a attt a doooot com ; well, nice idea, but that time I want to send it with b attt b doooot com, so I change it by choosing directly in the top options withing the compositing window (email account selected) well, I got an error saying me “error of smtp : message couldnt be sent with a attt a doooot com” even if I manually selected b attt b doooot com !

that means, in others words, that the “general default smtp account/server” overrides the compositing email window account selected. For me, it’s not a feature, it’s well a bug, I tried to explain there, with a very nice pic : https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1824146

where netc(mailo) is the choosen email provider I selected to send the email, but thundie decides in contrary to just keep in mind the “default general smtp account” (on screenshot, infomaniak, not the same provider as netc/mailo) instead of the last one I chosen!

how could I fix it without resetting/wiping the profile, from scratch?

I thank you vm!
creator: lm21

title: Since Thunderbird update 102, imcoming messages display in a very condensed hard-to-read font
content:
I set the default font to Arial in settings > fonts and colors. This does apply to composing messages - but not to how incoming messages are being displayed. This problem didn't exist until this week. What can I reset, or is there a way to clear some config profile, and reconfigure? Or would I have to roll back to an earlier release? IF that even helps.

Would appreciate any expertise!
creator: cyril.mocine

title: Exporting calendar from one computer in TB to inporting to another Computer in TB
content: I have been trying for months, even with there being several updates, I still can not import the calendar to my other desk top computer. Everytime I go and export my calendar with the only choice of ICS it continues to say the import is empty. Maybe there should be CVS as an option. However, I need help getting my calendar dates transferred to my other computer since the calendar does not sync using TB.
creator: metrorep

title: No notification when a filter moves messages to a directory.
content:
Hello everyone,

Two years ago the problem of notification when using filters was reported here: "https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1733782".

Today it still doesn't work in Thunderbird v102 on Windows 7.

Does this work for you with another configuration than mine?
creator: positron1

title: gmail failure
content:
Since uploading the current version of Thunderbird 102.10.1 (32-bit) neither of my GMail accounts will connect. When attempting to download mail, I get the following error: authentication failure while connecting to server imap.gmail.com

Two days ago, my GMail worked and without changing any settings, neither one will connect to the server. I have gone through all the settings in this article (https://mzl.la/3Pd9PXR) and everything is set correctly. Is there a problem with the current version and will there be a fix anytime soon???

title: My IMAP sent email is not syncing between different computers
content:
I read through the questions like this, some identical, that have already been answered. I did the steps, selecting subscribe on the sent folder on the computer with missing sent mail, clicked download and I did not get the missing sent message that was sent on another computer yesterday. I do have all my incoming mail for the account. This is a gmail account, windows 10 and 11.

So I guess I have no idea what's wrong. I think the sent message should be on the gmail server since it went through there. I just looked, it is. And on the gmail webmail it is marked INBOX, a gray square. I looked at the incoming mail in inbox that I had replied to and there it is. This is on the gmail webmail. But in thunderbird, the reply is not appended. And it's not in sent on a synced system. Something Google decided to do with their webmail that is not supported by Thunderbird?
creator: steve.waechter

title: new emails pop3
content: As of March 21 thunderbird stopped finding new emails. It logs onto the att.net pop3 server, searches, and comes back with no new emails found. Of course there are lots of new emails which I can see using the web browser. I have tried new inboxes, uping the search time with no help. This happened at the same time on 4 different computers!
creator: nfenster
